dt: {bc}different or distinct from the one first considered

dt.t: the same scene viewed from {wi}another{/wi} angle

dt: {bc}being one more in addition to one or more of the same kind

shortdef: different or distinct from the one first considered
being one more in addition to one or more of the same kind

dt: {bc}an additional one of the same kind {bc}one more

dt.t: one copy to send out, {wi}another{/wi} for the files

dt: {bc}one that is different from the first or present one

dt.t: Complaining about problems is one thing, but finding solutions to them is {wi}another{/wi}.

dt: {bc}one of a group of unspecified or indefinite things

shortdef: an additional one of the same kind : one more
one that is different from the first or present one
one of a group of unspecified or indefinite things

dt: used to say that one thing is very different from another

dt.t: She got good grades in math, but English was {it}another story{/it}.

shortdef: —used to say that one thing is very different from another

dt: used to refer to something to express the idea that it is very different in nature from something else

dt.t: Recognizing the problem is one thing, but finding a solution is {it}another thing{/it} altogether/entirely.

shortdef: —used to refer to something to express the idea that it is very different in nature from something else

dt: {bc}something that does not automatically follow from the previous stated fact

dt.t: I'm willing to help you, but if you're asking for money, that's {it}another thing/matter/story{/it}.

shortdef: something that does not automatically follow from the previous stated fact

pt: Some handbooks and textbooks recommend that {it}each other{/it} be restricted to reference to two and {it}one another{/it} to reference to three or more. The distinction, while neat, is not observed in actual usage. {it}Each other{/it} and {it}one another{/it} are used interchangeably by good writers and have been since at least the 16th century.

dt.t: We all do foolish things {it}at one time or another{/it}.

dt: {bc}to be equal to each other in force or importance but opposite to each other and thus have no effect

dt.t: The two arguments {it}cancel each other/one another out{/it}.

shortdef: to be equal to each other in force or importance but opposite to each other and thus have no effect

dt.t: I can't come {it}for one reason and another{/it}.
